that by requiring all customers and account holders to meet three foundational requirements before we even
start the onboarding process number one the account holder so the person that's actually making the request for access
to gov cloud must be a US person and by us person that's defined as either a US
citizen or a green card holder in addition to that the u.s. person must be affiliated working with an organization
that is a u.s. entity on US soil so us person plus us entity on US soil and
then the third core requirement is that neither the account holder or the
organization that is requesting access to go cloud can be barred from handling export controlled data so as part of our
vetting process we actually run checks to ensure that the account holder and the organization that they work for or
affiliated with do not show up in a State Department or the Department of Defense database that says you have
violated export control laws now that applies regardless of if you're going to be using go cloud for it-- our workloads
